header_summary: Olaoluwa Osuntokun announces the publication of the Taproot Assets Protocol and highlights modifications made since the initial drafts. Tom Briar suggests an alternative approach to handling lock time in transactions. ZmnSCPxj shifts focus to Lightning as a non-blockchain scaling solution. Olaoluwa Osuntokun discusses mapping the Taproot Asset Protocol onto the BOLT channel/invoice format. Greg Sanders emphasizes the importance of PTLCs and provides technical details. William Casarin questions the need for validating every RPC request unless for specific use cases.

recent_posts.title: BIP-????: The Taproot Assets Protocol
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the publication of the Taproot Assets Protocol and requests BIP numbers.
- The complete set of documents, including the breakdown of the BIPs, is on GitHub.
- The BIPs cover various aspects, including data structure, validation rules, address format, and more.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Currently, the system drops the 16 most significant bits and continues until a valid signature is obtained when a non-zero lock time is given.
- Tom suggests grinding the block height instead of the lock time to save space.
- Tom is working on adding an ideal transaction specification to the document.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender expresses initial interest in sidechains but recognizes they cannot scale.
- They recommend using Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains.
- The sender suggests a federated sidechain for prototyping features and mentions mainstake as an alternative.

recent_posts.title: blip-0029: Taproot Asset Protocol Channels
recent_posts.summary:
- A programmer has published a draft bLIP that maps the Taproot Asset Protocol onto the BOLT channel/invoice format.
- The bLIP introduces support for holding and transferring assets created by the Taproot Assets Protocol.
- The RFQ negotiation scheme allows multi-hop payments using Taproot Assets edge liquidity.

recent_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
recent_posts.summary:
- Greg discusses the importance of focusing on PTLCs with the upcoming deployment of taproot channels.
- He has shared a detailed analysis of PTLCs, including technical aspects and future updates.
- Greg invites feedback and suggests that his information could lead to discussions and standardization efforts.

recent_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the use of runes/macaroons for validating and authenticating commands.
- The sender questions the need for validating every RPC request with a hardware device and trusted display.
- The need for validation is considered unless there is a specific use case in mind.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains with fully blinded server.
- Security relies on trusting the statechain server to report the number of partial signatures.
- The protocol involves key and nonce generation, aggregation, and final signature computation.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Blockchain storage is sufficient, considering factors like block size and block time.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide 21 years of storage.
- Hardware costs decrease over time and optimization efforts reduce required space.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has submitted a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT with revised implementation.
- The proposal includes a new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV), and introduces a `flags` parameter.
- The new opcode allows for the full generality of MATT and only requires two opcodes.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed, addressing channel backup issues.
- It introduces a new channel funding transaction with additional spending paths and required opcodes.
- The proposal discusses asymmetric roles, state verification, fraud proofs, bandwidth savings, and alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the Lightning Network Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The summit aims to leverage Africa's cultural diversity, fragmented financial systems, and growing number of Lightning developers.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback and suggests surveying stable countries like Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting CSV file data, propagating an experimental TLV, implementing local reputation algorithms, and ensuring privacy.
- Node operators are encouraged to participate and refer to the email for more details.
